Bivitri Sebut Jokowi Pakai MK Sebagai Alasan Tak Teken Perpu KPK
03 Nov 2019, 07:07 by M Rosseno Aji, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Pakar hukum tata negara Bivitri Susanti menilai penjelasan Presiden Joko Widodo atau Jokowi yang tidak mau menerbitkan Peraturan Pemerintah Pengganti Undang-Undang Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (Perpu KPK) karena masih digugat ke Mahkamah Konstitusi menyesatkan.
Ia mengatakan presiden dapat menerbitkan perpu kapan saja. "Argumentasi presiden mau menunggu proses MK itu keliru. Itu pernyataan yang keliru dan menyesatkan. Menurut saya kok terlalu mengada-ada," kata Bivitri dalam diskusi di kantor Indonesia Corruption Watch, Jakarta, Ahad, 3 November 2019.
Pendiri Sekolah Tinggi Hukum Indonesia Jentera ini mengatakan penerbitan perpu merupakan hak subjektif presiden yang tidak bergantung pada proses MK atau proses legislasi. "Jadi perpu itu kapan saja presiden secara subjektif merasa ada hal ihwal kegentingan memaksa bisa keluar," kata dia.
Bivitri mengatakan dalih sopan santun yang disampaikan Jokowi juga tidak tepat. Ia yakin sembilan hakim MK yang menyidangkan gugatan UU KPK paham mengenai hukum.
Sebaliknya, Bivitri menduga Jokowi hanya menggunakan MK sebagai dalih untuk tidak mengeluarkan perpu KPK. Ia mengatakan sikap Jokowi itu mengindikasikan bahwa mantan Gubernur DKI Jakarta ini tidak mendukung pemberantasan korupsi.

Bivitri Calls Jokowi to Use the Constitutional Court as a Reason for Not Signing KPK's Regulation
03 Nov 2019, 07:07 by M Rosseno Aji, Syailendra Persada
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Constitutional law expert Bivitri Susanti assesses that President Joko Widodo's or Jokowi's explanation that does not want to issue Government Regulations in lieu of Corruption Eradication Commission Act (KPK Perpu) because it is still being sued by the Constitutional Court is misleading.
He said the president could issue a regulation at any time. "The president's argument for waiting for the Constitutional Court process is wrong. That statement is wrong and misleading. In my opinion, it's far-fetched," said Bivitri in a discussion at the Indonesia Corruption Watch office, Jakarta, Sunday, November 3, 2019.
The founder of Jentera Indonesia Law School said that the issuance of Perpu is a subjective right of the president that does not depend on the MK process or the legislative process. "So that whenever the president subjectively feels there is a matter of urgency to get out," he said.
Bivitri said Jokowi's excuse of courtesy was also incorrect. He was sure that the nine MK judges who were hearing the KPK Law suit understood the law.
On the contrary, Bivitri suspected that Jokowi only used the MK as an excuse not to issue KPK regulations. He said Jokowi's attitude indicated that the former Governor of DKI Jakarta did not support the eradication of corruption.
